verses.text: 弟兄們，關於我們主耶穌基督的再來，和我們到他那裡聚集的事，我們求你們：

words.note: A common address for fellow believers.
Refers to Jesus Christ.
Refers to the Second Coming of Christ.

verses.text: 無論有靈、有話、有冒我們的名的書信，說主的日子現在到了，你們都不要輕易動心，也不要驚慌。

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to a spiritual message/prophecy.
Refers to Jesus Christ.

verses.text: 不要讓人用任何方法迷惑了你們，因為主的日子來到以前，必定有背道的事，並且那不法的人，就是那沉淪之子，必定顯露出來。

words.note: Refers to Jesus Christ.
Lit. 'turn one's back on the Way (truth)'.
Often refers to eternal damnation or ruin.
Classical Chinese equivalent of '的'.
Directional complement indicating emergence.

verses.text: 他抵擋 神，抬舉自己，高過一切稱為神或受人敬拜的，甚至坐在 神的殿中，自稱為 神。

words.note: Here refers to a generic 'god' or 'deity', not the singular proper noun 'God'.

words.definition: to claim to be, call oneself

verses.text: 我還在你們那裡的時候，曾經把這些事告訴你們，你們不記得嗎？

words.note: Here forming a temporal clause: 'when I was there with you'.

verses.text: 現在你們也知道，那箝制他，使他到了時候才可以顯露出來的是甚麼。
因為那不法的潛力已經發動，只是現在有一個箝制他的在那裡，直等到那箝制解除了，

words.note: Refers to the mystery/power of lawlessness.

words.definition: to be present, to be at

verses.text: 那時，這不法的人必要顯露出來。主耶穌要用自己口中的氣除掉他，以自己再來所顯現的光輝消滅他。

words.definition: to get rid of, to remove

words.note: Indicates the following verb is acted upon.

verses.text: 這不法的人來到，是照著撒但的行動，行各樣的異能奇蹟和荒誕的事，
並且在那些沉淪的人身上，行各樣不義的欺詐，因為他們不領受愛真理的心，使他們得救。
因此， 神就使錯謬的思想運行在他們當中，讓他們相信虛謊，

words.note: Connects cause and effect.
Elevated character indicating reverence for God.
Indicates a consequence or immediate action.
Often used in religious contexts for deception.

verses.text: 叫所有不信真理倒喜愛不義的人，都被定罪。

words.note: Negation of faith or belief.
Key theological term for ultimate reality/truth.
Indicates a shift or contrast.
Opposite of righteousness; a common biblical concept.
To declare guilty; a judicial term in biblical context.

verses.text: 主所愛的弟兄們，我們應該常常為你們感謝 神，因為他從起初就揀選了你們，藉著聖靈成聖的工作，和你們對真道的信心，使你們可以得救。

words.note: A title of reverence for God or Christ.
Indicates the object of a verb is about to be mentioned.
Used for fellow believers in Christ.
Often used in biblical context for creation/foundation.
Key theological term for divine election.
Indicates the instrument or means by which something is done.
The third person of the Trinity.
The process of being made holy by God.
Refers to God's truth or Christian doctrine.
Essential term in Christian theology.
Central concept of redemption in Christianity.

verses.heading: Call to Stand Firm

verses.text: 因此， 神藉著我們所傳的福音呼召你們，使你們得著我們主耶穌基督的榮耀。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'; refers to the Christian message.
Often used for God's divine calling.
More formal than '得到' (dédào).
A central theological concept.

verses.text: 所以弟兄們，你們要站立得穩；你們所領受的教訓，無論是我們口傳的，或是信上寫的，都要持守。

words.note: Often used for receiving spiritual gifts or teachings.
Refers to doctrine or moral instruction.
Referring to teachings passed down by word of mouth.
Indicates location, 'in the letter'.

verses.text: 願我們的主耶穌基督自己，和那愛我們、開恩把永遠的安慰和美好的盼望賜給我們的父 神，

words.note: Refers to a divine or revered master.
Here refers to 'the one who...'
To open or bestow grace.
Introduces object of a verb before the verb.
Formal term for giving a gift or favor.
Used here to refer to God as Father.
The space often indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 安慰你們的心，並且在一切善行善言上，堅定你們。

words.note: Indicates a domain or aspect.
